title: Motion of a car from velocity table and graph

content.question:
The graph of the velocity v(t), in ft/sec, of a car traveling on a straight road, for 0 ≤ t ≤ 50, is shown above. A table of values for v(t), at 5 second intervals of time t, is shown to the right of the graph.

(a) During what intervals of time is the acceleration of the car positive? Give a reason for your answer

frqParts.text:
The graph of the velocity v(t), in ft/sec, of a car traveling on a straight road, for 0 ≤ t ≤ 50, is shown above. A table of values for v(t), at 5 second intervals of time t, is shown to the right of the graph.

(a) During what intervals of time is the acceleration of the car positive? Give a reason for your answer
(b) Find the average acceleration of the car, in ft/sec2, over the interval 0 ≤ t ≤ 50.
(c) Find one approximation for the acceleration of the car, in ft/sec2, at t = 40. Show the computations you used to arrive at your answer.

(d) Approximate<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>50</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <mi>v</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FAF@</annotation> </semantics> </math> with a Riemann sum, using the midpoints of five subintervals of equal length. Using correct units, explain the meaning of this integral.

topic.text: 2.1: Defining Average and Instantaneous Rates of Change at a Point

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
